abstract: John F. Antioco, the chief executive of Blockbuster, who has been locked in a dispute with company directors over the size of his bonus, has agreed to leave his job at the end of the year, but he will exit with far less than he initially wanted. Among those most satisfied by the outcome: board member Carl C. Icahn, who started the fight over Mr. Antioco’s pay.
lead_paragraph: John F. Antioco, the chief executive of Blockbuster, who has been locked in a dispute with company directors over the size of his bonus, has agreed to leave his job at the end of the year, but he will exit with far less than he initially wanted. Among those most satisfied by the outcome: board member Carl C. Icahn, who started the fight over Mr. Antioco’s pay.

headline.main: Icahn Gets His Way on Blockbuster Chief’s Exit Package
